subsection.name: Declaring a configuration in the Component Directive
subsection.p: We can modify the configuration behaviour by including a configuration within the block.xml deployment directive.
Resources supporting this tutorial are contained in the tutorials/configuration/block directory.
subsection.source:
<container name="hello">
<component name="hello" class="tutorial.HelloComponent"> <configuration> <source>explicit configuration within block</source> </configuration> </component>
</container>
subsection.p: Build and run the tutorial again.
In the logging output we see that the configuration supplied to the component has been overrided by the information we supplied inside the <component> directive.
subsection.source: [INFO ] (hello): configuration stage [INFO ] (hello): initialization stage [INFO ] (hello): source: explicit configuration within block

subsection.name: Using Defaults
subsection.p: The next tutorial shows how Merlin provides support for the packaging of default configurations with a component.
